content.value_statement: Organizations need systematic security assessments but lack specialized audit expertise. This skill provides comprehensive ISMS auditing capabilities for ISO 27001 compliance, security control testing, and certification preparation.
actual_capabilities: Design and manage risk-based ISMS audit programs following ISO 27001 requirements
Conduct security control assessments across organizational, technical, physical, and operational domains
Prepare organizations for ISO 27001 certification audits including Stage 1 and Stage 2 assessments
Evaluate cloud security implementations against compliance frameworks
Perform technical security testing integration including vulnerability assessments and penetration testing coordination
Generate compliance reporting and security finding documentation
limitations: Does not execute actual security tests or access external systems
Cannot perform real penetration testing or vulnerability scanning
Does not replace certified external auditors for formal ISO 27001 certification
Provides guidance and templates rather than automated compliance enforcement

use_cases.title: Internal ISMS Audit Program

use_cases.title: Security Control Verification

prompt_templates.title: Audit Planning
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me design a risk-based ISMS audit program for our organization. We need to cover the full ISO 27001 scope with quarterly assessments for high-risk areas.

prompt_templates.title: Control Assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a security control assessment checklist for ISO 27001 Annex A controls covering access control, cryptography, and operations security.

prompt_templates.title: Certification Prep
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare our organization for a Stage 1 ISO 27001 certification audit. What documentation and evidence do we need?

prompt_templates.title: Cloud Security Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct a cloud security audit for our AWS environment. What controls should we verify for shared responsibility model compliance?

output_examples.input: Help me plan our annual ISMS audit program for a mid-sized technology company.
output: Audit Program Structure: Quarterly technical assessments for high-risk systems, semi-annual control effectiveness testing for critical controls, annual full-scope compliance verification
Risk-Based Prioritization: Asset criticality analysis drives audit frequency, with internet-facing systems and data processing platforms receiving quarterly reviews
Documentation Requirements: Control implementation evidence, policy review records, training completion documentation, incident logs, and change management approvals

output_examples.input: What findings would we expect in an ISO 27001 control assessment?
output: Common Gap Categories: Access control weaknesses (overprivileged accounts, weak authentication), cryptography gaps (key management procedures, algorithm selection), operational issues (backup testing, change management)
Evidence Documentation: Policy documents, procedure records, configuration snapshots, training logs, incident reports, and management review minutes
Remediation Prioritization: Critical findings require immediate action, major findings need 30-day remediation, minor findings can be addressed in next audit cycle

best_practices: Align ISMS audit scope with organizational risk appetite and regulatory requirements before planning assessments
Maintain auditor independence by separating audit planning from remediation execution responsibilities
Document all findings with specific evidence references to support remediation tracking and certification evidence requirements
anti_patterns: Avoid conducting audits without documented criteria aligned to specific ISO 27001 control requirements
Do not rely solely on automated scanning without manual verification of control implementation effectiveness
Avoid audit programs that focus only on technical controls while neglecting administrative and physical security aspects

faq.question: What is the difference between ISMS and traditional security audits?
faq.answer: ISMS audits evaluate the entire information security management system including policies, processes, and their effectiveness, not just technical controls.

faq.question: How often should internal ISMS audits be conducted?
faq.answer: Audit frequency depends on risk levels. High-risk areas benefit from quarterly assessments while standard processes typically need annual review.

faq.question: Can this skill replace external auditors for ISO 27001 certification?
faq.answer: No. External certification requires accredited auditors. This skill supports preparation but cannot issue formal certification opinions.

faq.question: What documentation is required for ISO 27001 audits?
faq.answer: Core documents include information security policy, risk assessment methodology, control procedures, evidence of implementation, and management review records.

faq.question: How are audit findings prioritized for remediation?
faq.answer: Findings are ranked by risk impact and likelihood. Critical gaps affecting core security principles require immediate attention within defined timeframes.

faq.question: Does this skill work with cloud security assessments?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill includes cloud security audit frameworks for AWS, Azure, and GCP covering shared responsibility model compliance verification.
